page.title: 05TOURISM. TREDIS
page.content: Since the end of the 1939-45 War, tourism has steadily increased in this area.Visitors come from the Midlands,the North,London and, particularly, Bristol.Since the Plymouth-Roscoff Ferry started we have seen an increase of French tourists, especially cyclists.German visitors have been more evident over the past four or five years. The majority of the tourists are working-class or unmoneyed lower-middle class families, in contrast to the 1920-1940 period, when Downderry and district provided summer homes and playgrounds for the wealthy. Residential accommodation is available at the Sconner House Hotel, converted from an eighteenth-century house; Tredis House, a seventeenth century gentleman's residence, and the 16th. century Halfway House,Polbathic.
